alert.note: Alert for Nueces (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 12:01PM CDT until May 16 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL NUECES COUNTY... At 1201 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. There have been reports of flooding across portions of Corpus Christi including the Greenwood-SPID intersection and the 4500 block of Baldwin Blvd. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Corpus Christi, Del Mar College Heritage Campus, Cole Park, Del Mar College Windward Campus, Downtown Corpus Christi, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Corpus Christi North Beach and La Palmera Mall. This includes the following streams and drainages... Oso Creek and Corpus Christi Bay. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
